definition: lit. a straight foot has no fear of a crooked shoe/an upright man is not afraid of gossip (idiom)
pinyin: jiao3 zheng4 bu4 pa4 xie2 wai1

definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side
